alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clarendon (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Calhoun, Clarendon, Orangeburg, Richland and Sumter counties. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sumter, South Sumter, Elloree, Poinsett State Park, Santee State Park, Pinewood, Cameron, Paxville, Rimini, Low Falls Landing, Lone Star, Stumphole Landing, Poplar Creek Landing, Creston, Fort Motte, St. Paul, Privateer, Wedgewood, Cane Savannah and Lakewood. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 103 and 105. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
